subject: Inclusion of Provisions regarding accepting Insurance Surety Bonds (ISB) for Mobilization Advance in EPC Contracts - reg.
text: HRa 74 TTHTfqferaprut (13w5 4aev &1 RNANf 431T4, 4RGT TTIAT) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways; Government of India) Hna T 3il-5 & 6, Rarr-10, #RqT; # fcrit 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 TT/Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAII Policy Guidelines/ Finance & Accounts/ 2025 Policy Circular No.3.1.41/ 2025 dated 02nd January, 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No_ F.NHAI/CGM(F)/e-BG/202Z/e-157054-1/Part-2 (Comp. No. 199940)} Sub: Inclusion of Provisions regarding accepting Insurance Surety Bonds (ISB) for Mobilization Advance in EPC Contracts reg: In Supersession of Policy Circular No. 18.88/2023 dated 13.06.2023 and in Compliance to Ministry of Road Transport & Highways Letter No. NH-24028/14/2014-H(Vol-II) (E-134863) dated 31.05.2023 forwarded the amendments done by Department of Expenditure in GFR.2017 relating to inclusion of e-Bank Guarantee and Insurance Surety Bonds as mean to accept Bid Security' and Performance Security' MoRTH has already approved the changes in necessary clauses in the Standard documents (RFP and MCA ) of EPC HAM and BOT (Toll) modes which are already circulated by NHAI vide Policy Circular No. 18.88 / 2023 dated 13th June, 2023. 2 It is also pointed out that Highways Section of Ministry of Road Transport & Highways vide Letter NH-24028/14/2014-H(Vol-Il) (E-134863) dated 31.05.2023 has mentioned that 'For all the existing Contracts including Road Development, Toll Contracts, Ropeways and any other Contract wherein Ministry has prescribed a BG- any instrument of Bid Security / Performance Security may be replaced by Insurance Surety Bond= as per availability. 3_ In light of above, it has now been decided to accept the Insurance Surety Bonds' for Mobilization Advance in EPC Contracts with immediate effect. The relevant existing clauses vis-a-vis amended clauses of the Standard Documents for EPC will also change accordingly for necessary compliance by all Concerned. 4_ copy of these formats is also attached at Annexure "A and Annexure "B" for implementation. 5 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority: Encl:: As stated above (CS. Sanjay Kumar Patel) General Manager (Coord.) To: All Officers of NHAI HQ ROs/ PIUs/ CMUs/ Site Offices to: 1_ Hindi Division for translation in Hindi. 2_ Library for hosting the circular on library site. 3 Web Admin for circulation.
